neighbors.name: Wade & Tiffany Waddle
neighbors.claims: The Waddle family name has deep roots in Saline County farming, with records of Samuel H. Waddle settling in the area in 1866 ([KSGenWeb](https://www.ksgenweb.org/archives/1918ks/biow/waddlesh.html)). Wade Waddle serves as the Assistant Chief for Saline County Rural Fire District No. 1, where he actively secures grant funding for emergency equipment ([Citizen Portal](https://citizenportal.ai/articles/6536169/Kansas/Saline-County/Rural-Fire-District-No-1-authorized-to-accept-35000-in-foundation-grants-for-wildland-UTV)). In August 2023, Wade Waddle spoke at a Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission meeting regarding a proposed battery storage project near his residence on McReynolds Road ([Saline County](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)). He expressed specific concerns regarding the local fire district's resources and capability to handle emergencies at the proposed facility ([Saline County](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Assistant Fire Chief, Rural Fire District No. 1

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage directly regarding safety protocols. As a fire chief, his primary concern is emergency response capabilities. Demonstrate how the project will support, not strain, local fire districts (e.g., training, equipment donations) and address his specific testimony regarding resource shortages.

citations.claim: Samuel H. Waddle settled in the area in 1866
citations.title: Biography of Samuel H. Waddle

citations.claim: Wade Waddle serves as the Assistant Chief for Saline County Rural Fire District No. 1
citations.title: Rural Fire District No. 1 authorized to accept grants

citations.claim: Expressed concerns regarding local fire district capabilities
citations.title: Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission Minutes

neighbors.name: Justin D. Jensen
neighbors.claims: Justin D. Jensen is a resident of Gypsum, KS, and a recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies ([EWG](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=20169&progcode=tot_cfap2&page=2&yr=2023)). He is the son of the late Michael Ray Jensen, a lifelong farmer and rancher in the area ([Ryan Mortuary](https://www.ryanmortuary.com/obituary/Michael-Jensen)). Justin attended the August 22, 2023, Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission meeting regarding a Conditional Use Permit for development but did not provide public testimony ([Saline County](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)). His family's land history includes a 2004 property valuation dispute involving Richard R. and Sandra L. Jensen ([FindLaw](https://caselaw.findlaw.com/ks-court-of-appeals/1418887.html)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Active in local agriculture; attended zoning hearing

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with technical agricultural data. Given his attendance at previous zoning hearings and receipt of ag subsidies, focus on the economic stability the project offers to farming operations and the preservation of family land assets.

citations.title: EWG Farm Subsidy Database - Saline County

citations.claim: Son of the late Michael Ray Jensen
citations.title: Obituary of Michael Ray Jensen
Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission Minutes

citations.claim: Family land involved in 2004 valuation dispute
citations.title: Saline County Board of Commissioners v. Jensen

neighbors.name: Ronald A. & Sandra K. Kinkelaar
neighbors.claims: Ronald A. and Sandra K. Kinkelaar are landowners in Saline County with property interests impacted by local infrastructure projects, such as the K-4 Highway improvements ([KDOT](https://ikewebstorage.blob.core.windows.net/files/projects/KA-3230-02/004-085-KA-3230-02_Public-Meeting-Project-Maps.pdf)). They attended the Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission meeting on August 22, 2023, concerning solar and battery storage permits, though they did not speak during the public comment period ([Saline County](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out via a mutual contact or standard mailer. Acknowledge their long-term presence and interest in local infrastructure (evidenced by K-4 and zoning meeting attendance). Focus on low-impact design and property rights.

citations.claim: Property interests impacted by K-4 Highway improvements
citations.title: KDOT Public Meeting Project Maps

citations.claim: Attended Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission meeting August 2023
citations.title: Saline County Planning and Zoning Commission Minutes
